title: Lemniscate
summary: In algebraic geometry, a lemniscate is any of several figure-eight or ∞-shaped curves.[1][2] The word comes from the Latin "lēmniscātus" meaning "decorated with ribbons",[3] from the Greek λημνίσκος meaning "ribbon",[2][4][5][6] or which alternatively may refer to the wool from which the ribbons were made.[1]
